long: Meaning: a "sea" (as breaking in noisy surf) or "large body of water"; specifically (with the article), the "Mediterranean Sea"; sometimes a "large river", or an "artifical basin"; locally, the "west", or (rarely) the "south".  Usage: sea (Ã— -faring man, (-shore)), south, west (-ern, side, -ward).  Source: from an unused root meaning to roar;
